thread.title: Comment on Bernie Sanders will be in California next week by Elwood
thread.title_full: Comment on Bernie Sanders will be in California next week by Elwood

author: Elwood
title: Comment on Bernie Sanders will be in California next week by Elwood
text:
By Josh Richman Friday, October 9th, 2015 at 11:19 am in 2016 presidential election . 
After the first Democratic presidential debate Tuesday night in Las Vegas, U.S. Sen. Bernie Sanders is California-bound. 
Sanders will head to Los Angeles for a fundraising reception Wednesday evening at the Avalon Hollywood nightclub, where he’ll “discuss a wide range of issues including income and wealth inequality and the disappearing middle class, immigration reform, getting big money out of politics, criminal justice reform, and his college affordability plan.” Tickets cost $25, $50 or $100 . 
Sanders trails Hillary Clinton by 16 points in an average of nine recent national polls compiled by Real Clear Politics; he trailers her by six points in Iowa, but leads her by 11 points in New Hampshire. 
  Elwood 
Gee, Bernie’s visit sure seems to have caused a lot of excitement on here! JohnW 
Assuming anybody watches, it will be interesting to see if the debate stirs things up a bit on the Democratic side. The “others” (besides Hillary) aren’t exactly nobodies. Agree with him or not, Bernie says what’s on his mind, is a very good speaker and draws crowds. Jim Webb is a decorated Vietnam USMC veteran, Secretary of the Navy under Reagan and the guy who knocked off a household name conservative US Senator in Virginia. Martin O’Malley is the youngest of the group but both a former Mayor of Baltimore and Governor or Maryland. Elwood 
This election is as simple as ABC. 
Anybody But Clinton
